title: Israeli Security Cabinet Approves Military Takeover of Gaza
summary: The risky plan by Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is not backed by the Israeli military’s chief of staff and will thrust the war with Hamas into uncharted territory.

title: Trump Administration to Require Universities to Submit Data on Applicants’ Race
summary: The administration has become increasingly focused on admissions data in its effort to bring the higher education system in line with President Trump’s political agenda.

title: Trump Wasn’t the First to Deport These Men, and He Won’t Be the Last
summary: Dozens of Bhutanese men ejected from the United States are now in refugee camps in Nepal, which doesn’t want them but has nowhere to send them.

title: Trump Nominates Stephen Miran to Temporarily Join Fed Board of Governors
summary: If confirmed, Stephen Miran, the current chair of the Council of Economic Advisers, would temporarily fill a position left vacant by Adriana Kugler, who is stepping down early.

title: F.A.A. Plans to Hire 8,900 Air Traffic Controllers but Still Expects Shortages
summary: The Federal Aviation Administration says it plans to “supercharge” hiring and training between now and late 2028. It would not be enough to end a shortage of controllers.

title: Swiss Businesses Fear Trump’s 39% Tariff Will Create ‘Worst-Case Scenario’
summary: Goods shipped from the country face a 39 percent tariff in the U.S., which companies warn will have dire consequences if President Trump cannot be quickly dissuaded.

title: India Bought Russian Oil. Now It’s a Trade-War Weapon.
summary: If Narendra Modi surrendered to President Trump, how tough would it be to wean his country from Russia’s discounted supply?

title: Trump’s Tariffs Could Raise Prices on Many Consumer Goods
summary: The tariffs are driving up prices on everyday goods as businesses warn they can no longer absorb costs, leaving consumers to foot the bill.

title: On Vaccines, RFK Jr. Has Broken Sharply With the Mainstream
summary: While many officials and scientists embrace other parts of the secretary’s agenda, his stance on vaccines is alienating allies who fear a public health crisis.

title: Cuomo and Trump, Two ‘Queens Boys,’ Go Way Back
summary: President Trump has urged Andrew Cuomo to stay in the New York City mayor’s race. Here are seven moments when their paths crossed over the years.

title: The Rise of Silicon Valley’s Techno-Religion
summary: The Rationalists, a community focused on the risks of artificial intelligence, regularly gather with tech figures and other like-minded people in a complex that covers much of a city block.

title: OpenAI Unveils GPT-5, New AI Model, to ChatGPT Users
summary: The A.I. start-up said its new flagship technology was faster, more accurate and less likely to make stuff up.

title: Right-Wing Influence Shaped the Sydney Sweeney Ad Debate
summary: Right-wing commentators suggested there was widespread criticism of Ms. Sweeney over her new ad campaign. There wasn’t, at least at first.

title: Sallie Bingham, Author at the Center of a Newspaper Drama, Dies at 88
summary: A novelist and memoirist, she famously clashed with her brother, leading to the fall of a Kentucky publishing dynasty that her paternal grandfather established in 1918.

title: Why More People in the World Are Feeling Hopeful (Except Us)
summary: I would say the most important social trend over the past decade has been the disconnect between our nation’s economic health and its social health.

summary: Amy Klobuchar has taken a crucial step toward the view of the party’s base.

title: Canyon Fire in Ventura County Prompts Evacuation Orders for Thousands
summary: The Canyon fire was initially reported at about 30 acres but had rapidly grown to 1,500 acres in a few hours on Thursday, officials said.

title: Brandon Blackstock, Kelly Clarkson’s Ex-Husband, Dies at 48
summary: The announcement of Mr. Blackstock’s death came one day after Ms. Clarkson said she would be postponing the remainder of her residency in Las Vegas.

title: Big-Game Hunter Is Killed by Buffalo During Safari
summary: Asher Watkins, a real estate executive from Texas, was tracking a Cape buffalo in South Africa when he was attacked, a safari company said.

title: Should Soccer Star Son Heung-min Have Held an Umbrella for a Female Reporter?
